DataElement.preferredName: Prior Agent Intervention And Therapy-Related Toxicity Clinical Trial Eligibility Criteria Code Indicator
DataElement.preferredDefinition: A coded response as to whether a patient meets the eligibility criteria addressing prior agents that produce an effect, or alter the course of a disease in a patient and their associated  toxicities.

DataElementConcept.preferredName: Prior Agent Intervention And Therapy-Related Toxicity Clinical Trial Eligibility Criteria
DataElementConcept.preferredDefinition: Earlier in time or order._An active power or cause (as principle, substance, physical or biological factor, etc.) that produces a specific effect._An activity that produces an effect, or that is intended to alter the course of a disease in a patient or population. This is a general term that encompasses the medical, social, behavioral, and environmental acts that can have preventive, therapeutic, or palliative effects._An article which expresses the relation of connection or addition. It is used to conjoin a word with a word, a clause with a clause, or a sentence with a sentence._The finding of bodily harm due to the poisonous effects associated with the action or administration of therapeutic agents.               _Characteristics which are necessary to allow a subject to participate in a clinical study, as outlined in the study protocol. The concept covers inclusion and exclusion criteria.

ObjectClass.preferredDefinition: Earlier in time or order.:An active power or cause (as principle, substance, physical or biological factor, etc.) that produces a specific effect. (NCI)

Concepts.definition: An active power or cause (as principle, substance, physical or biological factor, etc.) that produces a specific effect.

Property.preferredName: Intervention or Procedure And Therapy-Related Toxicity Clinical Trial Eligibility Criteria
Property.preferredDefinition: An activity that produces an effect, or that is intended to alter the course of a disease in a patient or population. This is a general term that encompasses the medical, social, behavioral, and environmental acts that can have preventive, therapeutic, or palliative effects.:An article which expresses the relation of connection or addition. It is used to conjoin a word with a word, a clause with a clause, or a sentence with a sentence.:The finding of bodily harm due to the poisonous effects associated with the action or administration of therapeutic agents.:Characteristics which are necessary to allow a subject to participate in a clinical study, as outlined in the study protocol. The concept covers inclusion and exclusion criteria.

Concepts.definition: An activity that produces an effect, or that is intended to alter the course of a disease in a patient or population. This is a general term that encompasses the medical, social, behavioral, and environmental acts that can have preventive, therapeutic, or palliative effects.
An article which expresses the relation of connection or addition. It is used to conjoin a word with a word, a clause with a clause, or a sentence with a sentence.
The finding of bodily harm due to the poisonous effects associated with the action or administration of therapeutic agents.
Characteristics which are necessary to allow a subject to participate in a clinical study, as outlined in the study protocol. The concept covers inclusion and exclusion criteria.

ConceptualDomain.preferredDefinition: trial-specific criteria that a patient must meet to be enrolled.

ValueDomain.preferredName: Yes No Not Applicable Code Indicator
ValueDomain.preferredDefinition: Indicator to represent a response of Yes, No, or Not Applicable._The affirmative response to a question or activity._The non-affirmative response to a question._Determination that a value is not relevant in the current context._A system of numbered categories for representation of data.

ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: Determination of a value is not relevant in the current context.

Concepts.definition: Determination of a value is not relevant in the current context.

ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: The non-affirmative response to a question.

Concepts.definition: The non-affirmative response to a question.

ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: The affirmative response to a question or activity.

Concepts.definition: The affirmative response to a question.

ConceptualDomain.preferredDefinition: evaluations of the patient and the patient's disease.

RepresentationTerm.preferredName: Yes No Not Applicable Code Indicator
RepresentationTerm.preferredDefinition: The affirmative response to a question or activity.:The non-affirmative response to a question.:Determination that a value is not relevant in the current context.:A system of numbered categories for representation of data.:An event, entity or condition that typically characterizes a prescribed environment or situation and determines or aids in determining whether certain stated circumstances exist or criteria are satisfied.

Concepts.definition: The affirmative response to a question.
The non-affirmative response to a question.
Determination of a value is not relevant in the current context.
A symbol or combination of symbols which is assigned to the members of a collection.

An event, entity or condition that typically characterizes a prescribed environment or situation and determines or aids in determining whether certain stated circumstances exist or criteria are satisfied.

ValueDomain.changeDescription: Created to support Theradex design of CRFs for NCI CCR trials

ReferenceDocuments.name: Theradex - 1
ReferenceDocuments.description: Have a minimum of 7 days elapsed from the last dose of prior EGFR inhibitor and resolution of any drug-related toxicity to less than or equal to grade 2 except for alopecia?

ReferenceDocuments.name: Have a minimum of 7 days elap
ReferenceDocuments.description: Have a minimum of 7 days elapsed from the last dose of any agent and the resolution of associated drug-related toxicities?

ReferenceDocuments.name: Theradex - 3
ReferenceDocuments.description: Has patient been off prior therapy with any investigational agent administered as part of a Phase 0 study (also referred to as an "early Phase I study" or "pre-Phase I study" where a sub-therapeutic dose of drug is administered) at the Coordinating Center PI's discretion less than 2 weeks and failed to recover to eligibility levels from any toxicities?

ReferenceDocuments.name: Theradex - 6
ReferenceDocuments.description: If patient has received prior anti-CTLA-4, have a minimum of 12 weeks elapsed from the first dose of anti-CTLA-4 and more than 6 weeks from the last dose, and there is no history of severe immune-related adverse effects from anti-CTLA-4 (NCI CTCAE version 4.0)?

ReferenceDocuments.name: Theradex - 5
ReferenceDocuments.description: If patient has received prior anti-CTLA-4 have a minimum of 12 weeks elapsed from the first dose of anti-CTLA-4 and more than 6 weeks from the last dose, and there is no history of severe immune-related adverse effects from anti-CTLA-4?

ReferenceDocuments.name: Theradex - 8
ReferenceDocuments.description: If patient has had prior treatment with anti-CTLA-4 are the following requirements met: minimum of 12 weeks from the first dose of anti-CTLA-4 and more than 6 weeks from the last dose and no history of severe immune-related adverse effects from anti-CTLA-4 (NCI CTCAE 4.0)?

ReferenceDocuments.name: Theradex - 7
ReferenceDocuments.description: Does patient have toxicity greater than grade 1 from prior therapy (except alopecia or anorexia)?

ReferenceDocuments.name: Theradex - 9
ReferenceDocuments.description: If patient has had prior treatment with anti-CTLA-4 are the following requirements met: minimum of 12 weeks from the first dose of anti-CTLA-4 and more than 6 weeks from the last dose and no history of severe immune-related adverse effects from anti-CTLA-4 (NCI CTCAE 5.0)?

ReferenceDocuments.name: Theradex - 10
ReferenceDocuments.description: If patient has received prior experimental (non-FDA approved therapy or immunotherapies, this therapy was last administered more than 30 days or five half-lives of the drug (whichever is less) prior to the initiation of study treatment and patient must have fully recovered from any acute effects of these therapies?

ReferenceDocuments.name: Theradex - 12
ReferenceDocuments.description: Does patient have unresolved grade 2 toxicity from prior therapy (except alopecia or anorexia)?

ReferenceDocuments.name: Theradex - 11
ReferenceDocuments.description: Have a minimum of 7 days elapsed from the last dose of prior EGFR inhibitor and resolution of any drug-related toxicity to less than or equal to grade 1 except for alopecia?

ReferenceDocuments.name: Theradex - 13
ReferenceDocuments.description: If patient has received prior anti-CTLA-4, have a minimum of 12 weeks elapsed from the first dose of anti-CTLA-4 and more than 6 weeks from the last dose, and there is no history of severe immune-related adverse effects from anti-CTLA-4 (NCI CTCAE version 5.0)?

ReferenceDocuments.name: Theradex - 14
ReferenceDocuments.description: If patient has had prior treatment with anti-CTLA-4 are the following requirements met: minimum of 12 weeks from the first dose of anti-CTLA-4 and more than 6 weeks from the last dose and no history of severe immune-related adverse effects from anti-CTLA-4 (NCI CTCAE Grade 3 and 4)?

ReferenceDocuments.name: Theradex - 2
ReferenceDocuments.description: If patient has received prior bevacizumab or other experimental therapies, was therapy discontinued at least 4 weeks prior to treatment start or randomization and patient has recovered from toxicities to less than Grade 2?

ReferenceDocuments.name: Theradex - 4
ReferenceDocuments.description: If patient has received prior anti-CTLA-4, has a minimum of 12 weeks elapsed from the first dose of anti-CTLA-4 and more than 6 weeks from the last dose, and there is no history of severe immune-related adverse effects from anti-CTLA-4 (NCI CTCAE Grade 3 and 4)?
